intro: Citrullus colocynthis var. officinalis, commonly known as the bitter apple or colocynth, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is a hairy, annual plant that produces large, spiny fruits containing a yellow, bitter pulp. The plant is native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Asia, and it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Its fruit has been historically used in traditional medicine for its purported laxative properties. The plant's botanical features include large, lobed leaves and yellow, often self-fertile flowers.
